definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

sentences.english: I still cannot forget the cold winter, when you took me to the keyboard class.
sentences.chinese: 至今我也不法忘記你帶我學電子琴的那個寒冷的冬天。

sentences.english: There are my keyboard on the desk, and I often read the book.
sentences.chinese: 寫字檯上放着我的電子琴，還有我平時常看的書。

sentences.english: He is the keyboard player in this electronic band.
sentences.chinese: 他是這個電聲樂隊的電子琴手。

sentences.english: We study English and electronic organ.
sentences.chinese: 我們學習英語和電子琴。

sentences.english: I dislike playing once Electronic organ , but now I have changed my way of thinking.
sentences.chinese: 我曾經不喜歡彈奏電子琴，但現在我改變了這個想法。

sentences.english: I like electronic organ as well as English.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡電子琴，也同樣喜歡英語。

sentences.english: Electronic organs are much smaller and cheaper than pipe organs.
sentences.chinese: 電子琴要比管風琴小得多，也便宜得多。

sentences.english: My hobby is music and electronic organ.
sentences.chinese: 我的愛好是音樂和電子琴。

sentences.english: A: Do you play the keyboard?
I like electronic organ, also liking English equally.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡電子琴，也同樣喜歡英語。

definition: ukulele/simplified form also written 尤克里里琴
hulusi, aka cucurbit flute (a kind of free reed wind instrument)
type of opera from Taiwan and Fujian
